channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8558] Add timeout limit for HBaseClient dataOutputStream
item.description:
I run jstack at client host. The result is below.
"hbase-tablepool-60-thread-34" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00007f1e65a48000 nid=0x5173 runnable [0x00000000579cc000]
java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
at sun.nio.ch.EPollArrayWrapper.epollWait(Native Method)
at sun.nio.ch.EPollArrayWrapper.poll(EPollArrayWrapper.java:210)
at sun.nio.ch.EPollSelectorImpl.doSelect(EPollSelectorImpl.java:65)
at sun.nio.ch.SelectorImpl.lockAndDoSelect(SelectorImpl.java:69)

  • locked <0x0000000758cb0780> (a sun.nio.ch.Util$2)
  • locked <0x0000000758cb0770> (a java.util.Collections$UnmodifiableSet)
  • locked <0x0000000758cb0548> (a sun.nio.ch.EPollSelectorImpl)
    at sun.nio.ch.SelectorImpl.select(SelectorImpl.java:80)
    at org.apache.hadoop.net.SocketIOWithTimeout$SelectorPool.select(SocketIOWithTimeout.java:336)
    at org.apache.hadoop.net.SocketIOWithTimeout.doIO(SocketIOWithTimeout.java:158)
    at org.apache.hadoop.net.SocketOutputStream.write(SocketOutputStream.java:153)
    at org.apache.hadoop.net.SocketOutputStream.write(SocketOutputStream.java:114)
    at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flushBuffer(BufferedOutputStream.java:65)
    at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flush(BufferedOutputStream.java:123)
  • locked <0x0000000754e978a0> (a java.io.BufferedOutputStream)
    at java.io.DataOutputStream.flush(DataOutputStream.java:106)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseClient$Connection.sendParam(HBaseClient.java:620)
  • locked <0x0000000754e97880> (a java.io.DataOutputStream)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseClient.call(HBaseClient.java:975)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.WritableRpcEngine$Invoker.invoke(WritableRpcEngine.java:86)
    at $Proxy13.multi(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnectionManager$HConnectionImplementation$3$1.call(HConnectionManager.java:1395)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnectionManager$HConnectionImplementation$3$1.call(HConnectionManager.java:1393)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.ServerCallable.withoutRetries(ServerCallable.java:210)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnectionManager$HConnectionImplementation$3.call(HConnectionManager.java:1402)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.HConnectionManager$HConnectionImplementation$3.call(HConnectionManager.java:1390)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:303)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:138)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
    at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662)

This thread have hung for one hours

Meanwhile other thread try to close connection

"IPC Client (1983049639) connection to dump002030.cm6.tbsite.net/10.246.2.30:30020 from admin" daemon prio=10 tid=0x00007f1e70674800 nid=0x3d76 waiting for monitor entry [0x000000004bc0f000]
java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.flush(BufferedOutputStream.java:123)

  • waiting to lock <0x0000000754e978a0> (a java.io.BufferedOutputStream)
    at java.io.DataOutputStream.flush(DataOutputStream.java:106)
    at java.io.FilterOutputStream.close(FilterOutputStream.java:140)
    at org.apache.hadoop.io.IOUtils.cleanup(IOUtils.java:237)
    at org.apache.hadoop.io.IOUtils.closeStream(IOUtils.java:254)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseClient$Connection.close(HBaseClient.java:715)
  • locked <0x0000000754e7b818> (a org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseClient$Connection)
    at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseClient$Connection.run(HBaseClient.java:587)

dump002030.cm6.tbsite.net is dead regionserver.

I read hbase sourececode, discover connection.out doesn't set timeout

this.out = new DataOutputStream
(new BufferedOutputStream(NetUtils.getOutputStream(socket)));

I see this mean epoll_wait will block indefinitely.
item.summary: Add timeout limit for HBaseClient dataOutputStream

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Do you have a patch please?
Also can we have a more descriptive title?

Thanks wanbin for your detailed report ! Current impl has a default "0" value for timeout, it really need an explicit setting
Right now it's just a 0.94 branch issue, i found all 0.96+ branch have those similar code style already:


NetUtils.getOutputStream(socket, pingInterval);

Lars Hofhansl, i didn't add/run any test case, but it's just small, so, i guess OK

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12619777/HBASE-8558-0.94.txt
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12619777

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/8244//console

This message is automatically generated.
So the issue is: While we were writing something a RegionServer went down and we sit there forever waiting?
We need this in 0.96+ too, right Liang Xie. Patch looks good to me.

Lars Hofhansl,yes, current JDK doesn't support set socket write timeout directly. and the HDFS guys use nio select(xxx, timeout) code pattern to archive the socket write timeout indirectly. In our 0.94 codebase, we didn't pass the timeout parameter into NetUtils.getOutputStream(), so there's possible to observe that the client side will hang forever...
Stack, our 0.96+ has passed the timeout parameter right now, so no need to change(See RpcClient.java)
I am running "mvm clean test -P runAllTests" on my local box, if pass all, then will commit it shortly.

I have committed it into 0.94 branch, there're several failed cases in Mac notebook, even without this patch, need me to debug
Thanks Stack and Lars Hofhansl 's review.

SUCCESS: Integrated in HBase-0.94-security #365 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.94-security/365/)
HBASE-8558 Add timeout limit for HBaseClient dataOutputStream (liangxie: rev 1552888)

  • /hbase/branches/0.94/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/HBaseClient.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.94 #1233 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.94/1233/)
HBASE-8558 Add timeout limit for HBaseClient dataOutputStream (liangxie: rev 1552888)

  • /hbase/branches/0.94/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/HBaseClient.java
Emm, my mistake, seems i only resolved the normal scenario, but miss the security scenario. Attached a line minor change for SecureClient.java. Lars Hofhansl, wdyt?

+1
Feel free to commit
committed the addendum

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.94 #1239 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.94/1239/)
HBASE-8558 Addendum for handling SecureClient (liangxie: rev 1553452)

  • /hbase/branches/0.94/security/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/SecureClient.java
Does this ONLY affect 0.94? We should not commit to 0.94 only unless the other branches are not affected. Could you please provide trunk, 0.96 and 0.98 patches as well.
According to Liang above, this is only a 0.94 issue. (I am usually careful labeling jiras with the correct fix targets)
Sorry for false alarm. I was looking into 0.94 code apparently when I was reviewing the changes for this patch. Thanks for the notification.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.94-security #371 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.94-security/371/)
HBASE-8558 Addendum for handling SecureClient (liangxie: rev 1553452)

  • /hbase/branches/0.94/security/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/SecureClient.java
